name: eds
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
abbreviation for
Ehlers-Danlos syndrome : a group of inherited conditions (= ones passed from parent to child) affecting connective tissue (= the tissue that supports the structure of skin, bones, organs, etc.), which may for example allow the skin to stretch too much or the body to bend too easily: Patients with EDS present with hyper-elasticity of the skin and hypermobile joints. EDS is a genetic condition that affects connective tissue, the type of tissue in the body that provides support, structure, stability and normal scar formation.
More examplesFewer examplesEhlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS) refers to a group of heritable connective tissue disorders.The causes of menorrhagia are multiple and can include vitamin K deficiency and EDS (Ehlers-Danlos syndrome). The two most common types of EDS are the classic type and hypermobile type, which feature soft skin with varying degrees of stretchiness and poor wound healing.Some individuals with EDS (up to 25%) may have cardiac complications.
